result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

8:48 AM Defendant Preston Govan in court in custody at the Rock County Jail by video with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video.  David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived.  Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set, bond to continue. Motion to modify bond filed, victim wants to be notified per attorney Olson.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Victim has requested to be notified of all proceedings.
Pro Se
